senses.de: A way of measuring something or describing its size.
senses.ex: This box's dimensions are 2 feet by 3 feet.

Tips.title: Physical Objects
Tips.description: Use 'dimension' to talk about the measurable attributes of physical objects.
Tips.example: What are the dimensions of your new refrigerator?

Tips.title: Unit Specific
Tips.description: Always specify units when discussing the dimensions of an object.
Tips.example: The dimensions of the table are 120 cm by 80 cm.

Tips.title: Shape Indication
Tips.description: Dimensions can help visualize the shape of objects not seen firsthand.
Tips.example: A cube has three equal dimensions.

senses.de: A particular part or feature of a situation, problem, or thing.
senses.ex: We need to consider the problem in all its dimensions.

Tips.title: Analyzing Problems
Tips.description: Discussing all dimensions of a problem means considering all aspects or factors.
Tips.example: We examined every dimension of the issue before deciding.

Tips.title: Comprehensive Understanding
Tips.description: Use 'dimension' when emphasizing the depth of understanding required.
Tips.example: Studying the historical dimension of the event is crucial.

senses.de: A part of a situation or a factor that changes.
senses.ex: In this study, we added time as the fourth dimension.

Tips.title: Complex Situations
Tips.description: 'Dimension' can signify an added layer of complexity to a situation.
Tips.example: Introducing a cultural dimension makes the negotiation trickier.

Tips.title: Change Over Time
Tips.description: When time is called the 'fourth dimension,' it indicates change or progress.
Tips.example: The fourth dimension was crucial in understanding the historical trends.

senses.de: A possible universe or place, existing beside our own.
senses.ex: In the movie, the characters traveled through a portal to another dimension.

Tips.title: Imaginary Realms
Tips.description: In fiction, 'dimension' often refers to worlds that are separate from our reality.
Tips.example: The hero encountered a villain from an alternate dimension.

Tips.title: Creative Expression
Tips.description: Writers use 'dimension' to explore themes beyond our world; metaphors for ideas or conflicts.
Tips.example: The book added a new dimension to the classic good vs. evil plot.

Extent.wordDefinition:
Extent refers to how far or how much something exists or happens. For example, the extent of a forest fire would be how much land it has burned.

Dimension is applicable when measuring the size of an object in three dimensions, while extent is applicable when describing the scope or reach of something.

Height.wordDefinition:
Dimension refers to the overall size of an object or space, including its length, width, and height. Height specifically refers to the distance from the ground or base to the top of an object.

For example, a room may have dimensions of 10 feet by 12 feet by 8 feet (length, width, and height), while the height of a tree may be 20 feet tall.

Dimension is a more general term that encompasses all aspects of size, while height specifically refers to vertical distance.

Magnitude.wordDefinition:
Magnitude refers to the strength or amount of something, typically represented by numbers. For example, the magnitude of an earthquake could be measured on the Richter scale.

Dimension is used when talking about physical size and shape, while magnitude is used when referring to quantities or strength.

Measurement.wordDefinition:
Measurement refers to the act of quantifying or determining the size, amount, or degree of something using a tool or unit of measurement, such as a ruler, tape measure, or thermometer.

Dimension is what you can see or feel, while a measurement is the process of determining the numerical value of that dimension.

Proportion.wordDefinition:
Dimension refers to the size, length, width, height, or depth of an object, whereas proportion refers to the size or relationship of one part of an object to another.

For example, the dimensions of a rectangular box might be 10 inches long, 5 inches wide, and 8 inches tall. Proportions would refer to how these dimensions relate to each other, such as the length being two times the width or the height being three-quarters of the length.

Dimensions are applicable when describing the size or measurements of an object, while proportions are useful for analyzing design, aesthetics, and composition.

Scale.wordDefinition:
Scale refers to the relative size of objects or parts of a whole compared to each other. It is the proportion or ratio of the size of an object in real life compared to its representation in a drawing, map, or model.

For example, a house has dimensions such as length, width, and height. The scale of a drawing of the house would indicate the ratio of the size of the house in the drawing compared to its actual size in real life.

In this case, the scale could be 1:100, meaning that 1 inch on the drawing equals 100 inches in real life.

Dimension deals with the size and shape of an object, while scale deals with the relative size of objects or parts of a whole compared to each other.

Scope.wordDefinition:
Scope refers to the extent or range of something, such as the possible opportunities or limits associated with a particular situation or topic.

Dimension refers to the physical attributes of something while scope refers to the range or extent of something.

Size.wordDefinition:
Size typically refers to the overall magnitude or extent of something, often measured in comparison with other objects of the same type or category.

Dimension is used when discussing specific measurements of an object in multiple directions, while size is a more general term about the overall magnitude of something.

Volume.wordDefinition:
Volume refers to the amount of space occupied by an object or substance.

Volume can also refer to the loudness or quantity of sound or the amount of writing or speaking that occurs within a particular period.

Dimension describes the size or shape of an object, while volume refers to the amount of space that object occupies.

Width.wordDefinition:
Dimension refers to any measure of size, including length, width, and height. It is a more general term that can be used in various contexts, such as mathematical equations, engineering designs, and artwork.

Width specifically refers to the horizontal measure of something, usually from side to side. It is a more specific term that is commonly used to describe the size of objects and spaces, such as a door, a desk, or a room.

Dimension is a broader concept that includes many different ways of measuring size, while width specifically refers to the measurement from side to side.

quotes.Text: If you add children to a marriage, they bring a different dimension to the relationship. If I'd had a child and I believed it would have made my child's life better by not coming out, the chances are I wouldn't have done it. Because I think you do whatever it takes to make your child happy.
quotes.Title: Welsh Athlete
quotes.Name: Gareth Thomas

quotes.Text: My heart is mysteriously alive in the world of sounds - a totally different dimension from the daily life.
quotes.Title: American Artist
quotes.Name: Yoko Ono

quotes.Text: Each character I play has different dimensions. I'm not interested in words that pull them together.
quotes.Title: British Actor
quotes.Name: Alan Rickman

quotes.Text: I want to be taken out of our material world and experience something that is in another dimension.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Zak Bagans

quotes.Text: For the wise man looks into space and he knows there is no limited dimensions.
quotes.Title: Chinese Philosopher
quotes.Name: Zhuangzi

quotes.Text: I realize that I cannot live without a spiritual dimension in my life.
quotes.Title: American Historian
quotes.Name: Elaine Pagels

quotes.Text: I hadn't planned on or expected to have a public dimension in my life.
quotes.Title: American Celebrity
quotes.Name: Chelsea Clinton

quotes.Text: My life has a great degree of dimension without making movies.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Holly Hunter

quotes.Text: Each of my roles affects different dimensions of my life.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Mark Pellegrino

quotes.Text: Life has its dimensions in the mysterious.
quotes.Title: American Activist
quotes.Name: Jesse Jackson
